name: Pork and Wild Rice Casserole
author: kathleen
summary: This recipe is a delicious use of wild rice. Just be sure to season your ground pork if you don't buy it preseasoned (usually labeled as pork sausage). Fresh Italian sausage can also be used, just cut open the casing. Works great prepared a day ahead and re-heated for 20 minutes at serving time.
ingredients: 1 (18 ounce) can ready to serve cream of mushroom soup
1 (8 ounce) can sliced mushrooms, drained, liquid reserved
directions: Place rice and water in a pot and bring to a boil
Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 45 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook until evenly brown
Place pork in skillet and cook until evenly brown
Reduce skillet heat to medium and melt butter
Stir in onion and celery, and cook until tender; set aside
Mix flour into remaining butter until smooth
In a bowl, mix the reserved mushroom liquid and half and half; stir into the skillet and cook until thickened
Mix in 6 cups cooked rice, cooked bacon, cooked pork, mushrooms, almonds, pimento, parsley, salt, and pepper
Transfer to a 9x13 inch casserole dish
Bake 40 minutes in the preheated oven
